title: Immigration Crackdown Shifts Gears as Top Official Exits Minneapolis
description: In a sudden move, US President Trump has dispatched border tsar Tom Homan to Minneapolis, sparking speculation about the White House's changing stance on immigration. The development comes as Kevin McAleenan, the chief architect of Trump's controversial border policies, prepares to leave his post in the city.
content: In a surprise announcement, the US president has sent border chief Tom Homan to Minneapolis, signaling a potential shift in tone from the White House on immigration matters. The move comes as Kevin McAleenan, the architect of Trump's hardline border policies, prepares to depart his post in the city.

title: When Accusations Turned Against Me: The Shocking Truth Behind a False Rape Claim
description: A woman accused of making a false rape allegation shares her harrowing story, where a secret audio recording played a crucial role in clearing her name.
content:
It was the most surreal experience I've ever had. One minute, I was fighting for my reputation and freedom; the next, I was standing before a judge, accused of making a false rape claim.

The whole ordeal started when I accused a police officer of raping me. It was a horrific incident that left me shaken to the core. But what happened next took an even more disturbing turn.

A Secret Audio Recording Reveals the Truth

As the trial progressed, I realized that my own words were being used against me. The prosecution presented a recording of our initial conversation with the police, which they claimed showed that I was 'manipulating' the investigation to gain attention.

I was stunned. The audio recording had been taken out of context and edited to portray me in a false light. But it wasn't until I got a chance to listen to the unedited version that I realized what was really going on.

  • The original recording revealed that the police officer who took my statement was dismissive and unsympathetic, making me feel like I didn't matter.
  • The officer had even told me to 'move on' from the incident, implying that it wasn't a big deal.

This new information fundamentally changed everything. With the truth finally out in the open, I was able to prove that my accusation was genuine and not motivated by a desire for attention or revenge.

A Lesson Learned: The Importance of Context

The experience has left me with a valuable lesson – the importance of context in storytelling. It's easy to get caught up in our own emotions and biases, but it's crucial to take a step back, listen carefully, and consider multiple perspectives.

As I look back on this dark period in my life, I'm grateful that justice was ultimately served. But I also hope that my story can serve as a reminder of the devastating consequences of making false accusations – and the importance of treating all survivors with empathy and respect.

title: Labour Revolt: Fifty MPs Sign Letter Challenging Burnham's By-Election Ban
description: Fifty Labour MPs have signed a letter objecting to the National Executive Committee's decision to block Greater Manchester mayor Andy Burnham from standing in a by-election. The move has sparked concerns over party discipline and internal democracy within the Labour Party.
content:
Labour is reeling after fifty of its MPs signed a letter expressing deep disappointment with the National Executive Committee's (NEC) decision to block Greater Manchester mayor Andy Burnham from standing in a upcoming by-election.

A Divided Party

The move has sparked concerns over party discipline and internal democracy within the Labour Party, which is already struggling to maintain unity under current leader Keir Starmer. Critics argue that the NEC's decision sets a worrying precedent for future party leaders seeking to assert control.

Burnham, who has been at odds with Starmer's leadership since the start of his tenure, had initially announced his intention to stand in the by-election, only to be told he was not allowed to do so due to the NEC's rules governing party members' eligibility. The move has left many questioning the true motivations behind the decision.

A Party in Crisis?

The timing of this controversy couldn't be worse for Labour, which is still reeling from its crushing defeat in the 2019 general election and struggling to regain momentum ahead of the next UK-wide poll. As tensions within the party continue to simmer, many are left wondering what's next for Labour and whether these divisions will ultimately lead to a major overhaul or even the end of an era.

title: Leasehold Reforms Take a Giant Leap Forward: Ground Rents Capped at £250, Sale of New Flats Banned
description: The UK government has announced landmark reforms to the leasehold system, introducing caps on ground rents and banning the sale of new leasehold flats. The move aims to address long-standing concerns over unfair practices and give homeowners greater control.
content:
The UK government has taken a significant step towards addressing the long-standing issues plaguing the leasehold system, announcing reforms that will cap ground rents at £250 per year for existing leaseholders and ban the sale of new leasehold flats.

A New Era for Leaseholders

The move is designed to address the frustration and financial burdens faced by many homeowners who are tied to lengthy lease agreements with little control over their property. Ground rents, in particular, have been a source of contention, with some leaseholders facing annual bills that can exceed £1,000.

The proposed cap on ground rents will apply to all existing leaseholds, providing much-needed relief for homeowners who are struggling to manage their expenses. The ban on new leasehold flats is also expected to have a significant impact, as it will prevent developers from exploiting the system and leaving future generations of homeowners stuck with unfair agreements.

A Step Towards Greater Transparency

The government's reforms also aim to increase transparency in the leasehold market. From next year, freeholders will be required to provide detailed information about the property, including any outstanding maintenance costs or potential liabilities, before a sale is completed. This will help protect buyers from unexpected surprises and ensure they are fully informed before making a purchase.

  • New regulations will also require freeholders to obtain explicit consent from leaseholders before selling their property, giving homeowners greater control over the sale process.

The reforms have been welcomed by industry experts and consumer groups alike, who see them as a crucial step towards creating a more fair and sustainable leasehold system. With these changes in place, it is hoped that homeowners will be able to enjoy their properties without being weighed down by unfair financial burdens or lack of control.

title: Red Carpet Rumblings: Bafta Nominations Hint at Oscars Showdown
description: The Bafta nominations are just around the corner, and we're counting down to find out which stars will be fighting for the top prizes. Emma Stone, Timothée Chalamet, and Wunmi Mosaku are among the A-listers who could take home the coveted awards.
content:
The British equivalent of the Oscars is just days away from announcing its nominees, and speculation is reaching fever pitch.

The Contenders

Emma Stone, fresh from her critically acclaimed turn in 'The Favourite', is a strong contender for Best Actress. Meanwhile, Timothée Chalamet's heart-wrenching performance in 'Call Me By Your Name' could see him take home the award for Best Actor.

Oscar buzz surrounds Wunmi Mosaku too, with her powerful portrayal of Detective Katie Hopkins in BBC's 'Damascus' likely to impress Bafta voters. But who else might make the cut?

The Possibilities

  • Olivia Colman for Best Actress in 'The Favourite'
  • Rami Malek for Best Actor in 'Bohemian Rhapsody'
  • Judi Dench for Supporting Actress in 'All Is True'

As the clock ticks down to the Bafta nominations, we're excited to see which talented actors and actresses make it onto the coveted list. Will any of these stars go on to take home an Oscar come February? Only time will tell.

title: BBC Weather Icon Carol Kirkwood Says Goodbye: 'It's Been an Absolute Privilege' to Bring Viewers the Forecast
description: After decades of delighting audiences with her charming weather reports, Carol Kirkwood announced she's leaving the BBC. The 63-year-old stalwart of the Beeb's weather team said it's been a privilege to bring viewers the forecast daily.
content:
Carol Kirkwood, the beloved face of the BBC's weather forecasts, has revealed she's hanging up her meteorological hat after an illustrious career spanning over three decades.

A Tearful Farewell

In a heartfelt statement, the 63-year-old weather icon expressed her gratitude to viewers for their loyalty and enthusiasm. 'It's been an absolute privilege' to bring them the weather every day, she said, her voice trembling with emotion.

Kirkwood has become synonymous with BBC Weather, charming audiences with her warm personality, engaging delivery, and unparalleled forecasting skills. Her departure marks the end of an era for many Brits who've grown up watching her sunny disposition brighten their mornings.

A Legacy of Accuracy and Charm

Kirkwood's dedication to providing accurate and timely weather forecasts has earned her a reputation as one of the most trusted voices in British broadcasting. Her ability to balance science with storytelling has made her a household name, making it all the more poignant that she'll no longer be a daily fixture on BBC screens.

  • A stalwart of the BBC's weather team since 1997
  • Known for her warm and engaging delivery
  • Loved by audiences for her accuracy and reliability

title: Trump's Border Enforcer Headed to Minneapolis: A Shift in Tone or Tactics?
description: In a surprise move, President Trump is sending his border chief Tom Homan to Minneapolis as part of an apparent shift in tone from the White House. But what does this mean for immigration reform and the city's growing immigrant community?
content:
In a sudden turn of events, US President Donald Trump has chosen his border chief, Tom Homan, to lead an effort in Minneapolis, signaling a potential change in tone or tactics from the White House.

A New Approach?

The decision comes as a surprise to many, given Homan's reputation as a stalwart defender of Trump's hardline immigration policies. As the head of US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), Homan has been instrumental in enforcing the administration's 'zero tolerance' policy on illegal border crossings.

  • Apart from his role at ICE, Homan has also been involved in several high-profile deportation efforts

So, what could be driving this sudden change of pace? Some speculate that Trump is looking to soften his stance on immigration ahead of the 2020 presidential election. Others believe it's a move to placate moderate Republicans and independents who have grown increasingly concerned about the administration's treatment of immigrants.

The Minneapolis Connection

Minneapolis, with its thriving immigrant community, may be seen as an ideal testing ground for this new approach. The city has been at the forefront of the national conversation around immigration reform, and local leaders have been vocal in their criticism of Trump's policies.

For many in Minneapolis, the arrival of Homan will spark concerns about the impact on the city's immigrant community. 'This is a big deal for us,' says Maria Rodriguez, executive director of the Minneapolis-based advocacy group, El Vale. 'We're worried that this could lead to increased enforcement and deportation efforts.' However, some see this as an opportunity to engage with Homan and challenge his views.

A Shift in Tone?

As Trump's border chief, Homan has been at the forefront of enforcing the administration's hardline stance on immigration. His appointment to lead the effort in Minneapolis could signal a desire to shift tone or tack towards a more moderate approach. 'This is an opportunity for Tom Homan to show that he's willing to listen and work with people,' says Professor Peter Brownell, an expert on immigration policy at the University of Minnesota.

While it's unclear what this new direction will ultimately mean for Minneapolis or the nation as a whole, one thing is certain: the arrival of Tom Homan in the city will spark heated debate and scrutiny. As the stakes continue to rise, only time will tell if this sudden shift is a genuine attempt at reform or just another calculated move in Trump's ongoing immigration saga.

title: TR-1000 Takes Center Stage: Roland's Analog Drum Machine Revolutionizes Music Production
description: After years of anticipation, Roland finally delivers a worthy successor to the legendary TR-808 drum machine. The TR-1000 brings forth an unparalleled sonic experience that redefines modern music production.
content:
A New Era in Music Production

It's been a long-awaited moment for musicians and producers worldwide: Roland has finally unveiled the TR-1000, its analog drum machine successor to the iconic TR-808. This behemoth of sound engineering promises to shake the foundations of modern music production, offering an unparalleled sonic experience that will leave you breathless.

The TR-1000 is more than just a nostalgic nod to the past; it's a bold declaration of Roland's commitment to innovation and quality. With its sleek design and intuitive interface, this drum machine is poised to become the go-to tool for producers seeking to craft infectious beats that will resonate with audiences worldwide.

A Sonic Legacy Lives On

The TR-808's influence on modern music cannot be overstated. Its unmistakable kick drum sound has been embedded in the DNA of genres ranging from hip-hop and electronic dance music (EDM) to rock, pop, and beyond. Roland's decision to revive this legendary sound in the form of the TR-1000 is a testament to its enduring appeal and staying power.

  • The TR-1000 boasts 17 analog drum sounds, each carefully crafted to evoke the warm, rich tones of its predecessor.
  • A dedicated '808' mode allows producers to access the original TR-808 sound with precision and clarity.
  • Comprehensive editing capabilities enable users to shape their sound with unparalleled precision.

The TR-1000 is an instrument that will ignite the creative spark within musicians and producers, inspiring a new wave of innovative music-making. It's time to welcome this analog drum machine into your studio and unlock its boundless potential.

title: Rise of the Machines: JudgeGPT Revolutionizes Justice
description: Meet Bridget McCormack, the former Michigan Supreme Court chief justice now pioneering AI-powered judging with JudgeGPT. This innovative tool is changing the game for fair and efficient justice.
content:
The Birth of a New Era in Justice

Bridget McCormack, former chief justice on the Michigan Supreme Court, has spent her career ensuring that judges at lower courts follow the rules. Now, she's taking it to the next level by developing JudgeGPT, an AI-powered tool designed to correct judicial mistakes and promote fairer verdicts.

As a judge-reviewer, McCormack was responsible for examining complaints about how lower-court judges handled cases. Her experience has uniquely prepared her to create JudgeGPT, which leverages machine learning algorithms to analyze evidence and identify potential errors in judicial decisions.

The Power of AI in Justice

JudgeGPT's capabilities go far beyond mere data analysis. This cutting-edge tool is designed to learn from its mistakes, adapting its approach over time to become increasingly accurate and effective. The result? A more efficient and fair justice system that can handle the ever-growing complexities of modern society.

  • AI-powered judging reduces bias and increases transparency
  • JudgeGPT's continuous learning capabilities ensure it improves with each new case

title: Xbox Cloud Gaming's Sleek Redesign Suggests a Console UI Revolution
description: Microsoft has unleashed a fresh web experience for Xbox Cloud Gaming, and it's giving us major console vibes. With its revamped navigation, animations, and design, this new UI might just be the precursor to a game-changing overhaul of Xbox consoles.
content:
Xbox Cloud Gaming Takes a Giant Leap Forward

Microsoft has been quietly testing a refreshed web experience for Xbox Cloud Gaming, and the early results are nothing short of astounding. As part of its Insider program, select users can now get their hands on the new UI, which is giving us major console vibes.

The first thing that strikes you about this new design is how console-like it feels. The navigation has been streamlined, with a focus on intuitive menus and an abundance of white space to reduce clutter. It's a far cry from the crowded interfaces we're used to seeing online.

But it's not just about aesthetics – Microsoft has also added a wealth of new animations to make the experience feel more dynamic. From the way the icons bounce into place when you hover over them to the smooth transitions between pages, every detail has been carefully considered to create a sense of fluidity and cohesion.

So what does this mean for the future of Xbox consoles? Only time will tell, but it's hard not to feel like we're being given a glimpse into the direction Microsoft might take its console UI in the years to come. With its emphasis on simplicity, ease of use, and visual flair, this new design could be just what Xbox needs to stay ahead of the curve.

title: Meta's Premium Revolution: Unlocking AI-Powered Features for Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp
description: Get ready to elevate your social media experience! Meta is set to roll out premium subscriptions for its trio of popular platforms, offering expanded AI capabilities and exclusive features. But what does this mean for users?
content:
Meta is taking the next step in its quest to revolutionize the world of social media with the impending launch of premium subscriptions for Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp.

A New Era of Productivity

The upcoming subscription plans aim to 'unlock more productivity and creativity' by providing premium users with more control over how they share content, as well as access to advanced AI-powered features.

  • Expanded AI capabilities: Users will be able to tap into the power of artificial intelligence to streamline their social media experience.
  • Additional features: Premium subscribers can expect a range of new tools and functionalities designed to make sharing and discovering content more seamless.

While the specifics of these premium offerings are still under wraps, one thing is certain – this move marks a significant shift in Meta's approach to monetizing its platforms.

title: Apple Watch Users Rejoice: Strava and Komoot Bring Offline Maps to End Frustrating Connectivity Issues
description: Strava and Komoot, two of the most popular apps for outdoor enthusiasts, are finally bringing offline maps to Apple Watch users, eliminating the need for constant internet connectivity. This means you can track your routes, record workouts, and explore new territories without being tethered to Wi-Fi or cellular signals.
content:
In a move that's sure to delight cyclists, hikers, and runners alike, Strava and Komoot are bringing offline maps to Apple Watch users.

This means you can leave your phone behind and still track your routes, record workouts, and explore new territories without being tethered to Wi-Fi or cellular signals. No more worrying about dead zones or dropped connections – just pure, unadulterated freedom.

The Benefits of Offline Maps

  • No more relying on spotty cell service or Wi-Fi hotspots.
  • No more lost signal strength causing you to lose your connection and your route.
  • No more worrying about battery drain from constant GPS tracking.

In short, offline maps for Apple Watch users mean a seamless experience that lets you focus on your workout or adventure, not your phone's connectivity issues.

title: Roland's TR-1000 Revolutionizes Electronic Music with Analog Drum Machine
description: After years of anticipation, Roland has finally released the TR-1000, a long-awaited analog successor to the legendary TR-808. This powerful drum machine promises to reinvigorate electronic music production with its unique sound and versatility.
content:
The wait is finally over for music producers and enthusiasts alike as Roland unleashes the TR-1000, a cutting-edge analog drum machine that pays homage to the iconic TR-808.

A New Era in Electronic Music

This long-awaited successor combines the best of both worlds - the warm, rich sound of analog drums with the flexibility and precision of modern digital technology. The result is an instrument capable of creating a vast array of sonic landscapes, from classic TR-808-inspired beats to innovative and experimental sounds.

  • With its analog circuitry and high-quality components, the TR-1000 delivers a distinctively warm and engaging sound that will transport producers back to the golden age of electronic music.
  • A powerful sequencer allows for intricate patterns and complex rhythms, giving musicians unparalleled creative control over their beats.

The TR-1000 is set to revolutionize electronic music production, offering artists a new canvas upon which to create and innovate. Whether you're a seasoned producer or just starting out, this drum machine is sure to inspire a new wave of creativity and artistic expression.

title: Judge McCormack Leaps into AI Era as 'JudgeGPT' Pioneer
description: Bridget McCormack, a seasoned jurist with a knack for correcting judges' work, is now at the forefront of a revolutionary AI-powered judicial tool. As JudgeGPT, she's poised to transform the way justice is served.
content:
Bridget McCormack, former chief justice on the Michigan Supreme Court, has spent her career scrutinizing judges' decisions for errors in judgment and procedure. Now, as the pioneering force behind 'JudgeGPT', she's harnessing artificial intelligence (AI) to elevate judicial excellence.

A New Era of Judicial Oversight

In her previous role, McCormack reviewed complaints about judges at lower courts failing to consider key evidence or rule on crucial aspects of a case. With JudgeGPT, she's bringing this expertise to the forefront of AI-powered judicial tool development.

  • Aims to improve judicial efficiency and accuracy
  • Will provide real-time analysis and guidance for judges worldwide

title: Xbox Cloud Gaming's Revamped UI Hints at a Bolder Future for Xbox Consoles
description: Microsoft has unleashed a refreshed web experience for Xbox Cloud Gaming, offering a glimpse into the evolving design language of Xbox consoles. The new UI, now available to Xbox Insiders, boasts updated navigation features and animations, setting the stage for what's to come.
content:
Xbox Cloud Gaming has taken a significant step towards unifying its web experience with that of Xbox consoles. Microsoft has started testing a refreshed design for the cloud gaming platform, giving Xbox Insiders a first look at the new UI.

A New Era for Xbox Design

The revamped web experience is characterized by updated navigation features, an abundance of new animations, and a refreshed visual identity. While this redesign is primarily aimed at enhancing the cloud gaming experience, it also hints at the direction Microsoft might take with its console UI in the years to come.

The new design's focus on fluidity and responsiveness aims to create a seamless transition between the web and Xbox consoles. The preview UI offers a glimpse into what Xbox fans can expect from future console updates, which could potentially bring a more unified look across platforms.

title: Meta's Premium Plan Aims to Supercharge Social Media Experiences
description: In a bid to boost engagement and user satisfaction, Meta is set to launch premium subscriptions for Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp. The new plans promise expanded AI capabilities, additional features, and greater control over sharing.
content:
Meta is taking a significant step towards enhancing its social media ecosystem by introducing premium subscriptions for Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp.

A New Era of Social Media

The upcoming subscription plans aim to 'unlock more productivity and creativity' by providing users with 'more control over how they share' content. This move is expected to bring significant changes to the way users interact with their favorite social media platforms.

According to TechCrunch, the premium features will include expanded AI capabilities that can help users streamline their online activities. Additionally, subscribers will enjoy access to new and improved tools designed to increase productivity and creativity.

  • Instagram: Users can expect advanced photo and video editing tools, as well as enhanced discovery features.
  • Facebook: The platform will offer more robust group management capabilities and personalized news feeds.
  • WhatsApp: The messaging app will introduce advanced chat filters and increased file sharing limits.

The introduction of premium subscriptions is seen as a strategic move by Meta to differentiate its services from those offered by rival social media platforms. As the online landscape continues to evolve, it remains to be seen how users will respond to these new offerings.

title: Apple Watch Users Rejoice: Strava and Komoot Bring Offline Maps to Wearable
description: The wait is over for Apple Watch users who rely on Strava and Komoot for their outdoor adventures. The two popular apps have finally brought offline maps to the wearable, a feature that's been long-awaited by many.
content:
In a move that's sure to delight athletes and outdoor enthusiasts alike, Strava and Komoot have announced the integration of offline maps on Apple Watch.

A Game-Changer for On-the-Go Users

This long-overdue feature allows users to access routes and record their workouts without needing to carry a phone or rely on cellular connectivity. No more worrying about drained batteries or spotty signal strength!

  • Strava's offline maps will enable users to explore new trails, follow pre-planned routes, and even analyze their performance data in real-time.
  • Komoot, meanwhile, promises seamless navigation with its own proprietary map technology, ensuring that users never lose their way.

The implications are significant: athletes can now focus on their workout rather than worrying about staying connected. For outdoor enthusiasts, the ability to venture off-grid without sacrificing navigation capabilities is a major plus.

title: TikTok's Technical Turmoil: Power Outage, Systems Failure, and a New Era of Uncertainty
description: More than a day after the outage began, TikTok USDS confirms that the platform's issues stem from a power outage at a data center and subsequent cascading systems failure. As the new ownership by Oracle & Co settles in, users are left wondering what's next for their favorite social media app.
content:
TikTok's troubles continue, with the popular short-form video-sharing platform still experiencing widespread outages more than 24 hours after issues first emerged.

A Power Outage to Blame?

According to a statement from TikTok USDS, the root cause of the outage can be traced back to a power outage at one of its data centers, which in turn triggered a cascading systems failure. This unexpected twist has left users scratching their heads and wondering what's next for the social media sensation.

  • TikTok's troubles began early Sunday morning, just days after Oracle & Co took the reins as new owners.
  • The power outage at the data center is believed to have been the catalyst for the subsequent systems failure, which has left users unable to access their accounts or upload new content.

In a statement, TikTok USDS assured users that they are working diligently to resolve the issue and get the platform back up and running as soon as possible. With the new ownership by Oracle & Co still settling in, this technical hiccup has raised concerns about the future of the popular app and what changes may be on the horizon.

title: EU Launches Probe into X's Grok AI Chatbot over Sexualized Deepfakes
description: The European Commission has announced an investigation into X, a leading tech firm, regarding the sexualized deepfakes generated by its Grok AI chatbot. The probe aims to assess whether X properly addressed risks associated with the technology within the EU.
content:
The European Union has taken steps to scrutinize X's use of Grok, an AI-powered chatbot capable of generating highly realistic and potentially harmful deepfakes.

Concerns over Risks

The Commission's investigation will focus on evaluating whether X adequately assessed and mitigated the risks associated with Grok's image-generating capabilities within the EU. This move comes after reports surfaced that the AI chatbot had been used to create sexualized deepfakes, sparking concerns about potential misuse.

Legal and Ethical Consequences

The probe also aims to determine whether X complied with existing regulations and guidelines governing the development and deployment of such technology. If findings indicate non-compliance, X may face legal consequences or reputational damage as a result.

  • Advocacy groups and lawmakers have long raised concerns about the potential risks and ethical implications of AI-generated deepfakes
  • The Commission's investigation is seen as a crucial step in ensuring the responsible development and use of such technology

title: Stay Connected: Top Bluetooth Trackers for Apple and Android Devices
description: Say goodbye to lost items! Discover the best Bluetooth trackers that seamlessly pair with your Apple or Android phone, ensuring you're always in control.
content:
Track Down Your Essentials

In today's fast-paced world, it's easy to misplace essential items. But what if there was a way to keep tabs on your belongings without the hassle of stickers or tags? Enter Bluetooth trackers – simple, yet ingenious devices that pair with your phone to help you locate anything that matters.

From keys and wallets to bags and backpacks, these trackers provide real-time location updates, ensuring you're always one step ahead. And the best part? They work seamlessly with both Apple and Android devices.

Whether you're a busy professional on-the-go or an adventure-seeker always on the move, these top-rated Bluetooth trackers will help you stay connected and in control. So why wait? Start tracking your essentials today!

title: Google Agrees to Pay $68 Million in Settlement Over Secretly Recorded Conversations
description: In a significant settlement, Google has agreed to pay out $68 million to resolve a class-action lawsuit over its handling of recorded conversations captured by its devices. The issue arose when devices were activated by something other than the trigger word 'Ok Google'.
content:
Google has reached an agreement to settle a class-action lawsuit regarding its handling of recorded conversations captured by its devices, according to court filings from last Friday.

A Closer Look

The issue at hand stems from German outlet VRT NWS's 2019 report exposing how Google Assistant would capture and record conversations without users' explicit permission when devices were activated by something other than the trigger word 'Ok Google'. This led to concerns over privacy and potential misuse of sensitive information.

In an effort to resolve these concerns, Google has agreed to pay out $68 million as part of the settlement. The agreement aims to provide compensation to affected users who had their conversations recorded without consent.

  • Google Assistant would capture and record conversations when devices were activated by something other than the trigger word 'Ok Google'
  • The issue was first exposed in a 2019 report by German outlet VRT NWS
  • Google has agreed to pay out $68 million as part of the settlement

title: Sweep Away Your Worries: The Top Budget Robot Vacuums for a Spotless Home
description: Leave the cleaning to the robots! Discover the best budget robot vacuums that will revolutionize your daily chores, from pet-hair-magnet to mess-remover. Get ready to swoon over these game-changing gadgets!
content:
As we navigate the realm of smart home devices, it's easy to get caught up in the whirlwind of innovation and forget about the humble beginnings of our beloved robot vacuum cleaners. Once upon a time, they were simple machines that got the job done – and still do! But with so many features, upgrades, and fancy trimmings available, it's high time we revisit what matters most: finding the best budget robot vacuums for your buck.

A Budget-Friendly Revolution

In a world where cleaning is just as important as being connected, it's no surprise that budget-friendly options have taken center stage. After all, who doesn't love a good deal? The following top picks will change the way you clean – or at least make it more enjoyable!

  • Eufy RoboVac 11: This sleek and slim device is a force to be reckoned with, boasting advanced navigation and powerful suction. And did we mention its whisper-quiet operation?
  • iRobot Roomba i3+: With its impressive ability to adapt to various floor types and navigate around furniture, this Roomba has got the skills – all while being surprisingly affordable!
  • Shark ION 750: When it comes to pet-hair-magnets, this Shark robot is the real MVP. Its advanced navigation system ensures a thorough cleaning, leaving your floors spotless and pet-friendly.

So what makes these budget robot vacuums so special? For starters, they're all under $500 – talk about a bargain! But more importantly, they've got the brains (and brawn) to take on those pesky crumbs and dust bunnies. Whether you're a busy bee or a tech-obsessed enthusiast, these game-changing gadgets are sure to sweep away your worries.

title: Winter Storm Unleashes Chaos on AI-Driven Power Grids
description: The winter storm that crippled 34 states has left power grids reeling, with wholesale electricity prices soaring in Virginia as AI data centers put an unprecedented strain on the system. As temperatures plummeted, a perfect storm of challenges emerged.
content:
The United States was hit by a severe winter storm that affected millions of people, leaving hundreds of thousands without electricity and many more struggling to stay warm.

Affected Areas

The impact of the storm was felt across 34 states, including Virginia, which bore the brunt of the cold temperatures. The southeastern region, particularly Tennessee, Kentucky, and North Carolina, were also severely affected.

Power Grids Under Strain

As the storm ravaged through the country, power grids struggled to cope with the increased demand. A surge in energy consumption due to heating systems was exacerbated by the proliferation of AI data centers, which are notoriously power-hungry.

  • A recent report revealed that a single AI data center can consume as much electricity as an entire town.
  • This massive appetite for energy has put pressure on power grids, making them more susceptible to outages and price spikes.

Consequences

The consequences of this perfect storm were far-reaching. Wholesale electricity prices in Virginia soared over the weekend, leaving residents facing a triple whammy: freezing temperatures, widespread power outages, and skyrocketing energy costs.

As the nation begins to recover from the devastating effects of Winter Storm Fern, it is essential to recognize that AI-driven data centers will continue to strain our power grids. A concerted effort must be made to develop more efficient and sustainable solutions to meet this growing demand.

title: Get Fit, Get Connected: The Top Fitness Trackers & Watches to Supercharge Your Workouts
description: Fitness trackers have evolved into powerful tools that track your progress and keep you motivated. We put the best ones to the test – here's what we found out.
content:
When it comes to fitness, having the right gear can be a game-changer. Fitness trackers have come a long way since their humble beginnings as simple pedometers. Today's top models offer an impressive array of features that can help you track your progress, stay motivated, and even improve your overall health.

What Makes a Great Fitness Tracker?

While all fitness trackers share the same basic goal – to help you move more and sit less – they vary significantly in terms of their features, accuracy, and ease of use. To find the best ones, we put 10 top contenders through a rigorous testing process.

  • We tested each tracker's ability to accurately track steps, distance traveled, and calories burned.
  • We also evaluated their heart rate monitoring capabilities, GPS tracking, and water resistance.
  • And finally, we judged the overall user experience, including ease of setup, data visualization, and notification features.

The Top Fitness Trackers & Watches:

After putting each tracker through its paces, we're pleased to present our top picks:

  1. Fitbit Charge 4: This budget-friendly option offers an impressive range of features for the price, including heart rate monitoring and GPS tracking.
  2. Samsung Galaxy Watch Active 2: This stylish smartwatch packs a punch with its advanced health tracking features, including electrocardiogram (ECG) readings.
  3. Polar Vantage V: For serious athletes, this watch offers unparalleled performance tracking and coaching capabilities.

Whether you're a casual jogger or an elite athlete, the right fitness tracker can be a valuable tool in your fitness journey. By choosing the best one for your needs, you'll be well on your way to achieving your goals – and having fun along the way!

title: Meta's Big Bet: Can $6.4 Million Ads Convince You to Love Data Centers?
description: In a bold move, Meta has spent a staggering $6.4 million on an ad campaign to win over the hearts and minds of Americans about data centers. But will it work? We dig in.
content:
Meta, the parent company of Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, has embarked on an unusual mission: to make you love data centers.

The tech giant has invested a whopping $6.4 million over the last few months of 2025 in an ad campaign that's been running in cities across the United States, from Sacramento to Washington.

The Ads: A Folksy Approach

The ads are short, folksy video spotlights showcasing everyday people and their daily lives, with a subtle twist: they're all connected to Meta's data centers.

In one ad, a mom is seen juggling work and family responsibilities while her kids play in the background. The tagline? 'Keeping memories safe.' In another, a group of friends are shown hanging out at a coffee shop, with the caption: 'Storing stories for good.'

The Mission: Redefining Data Centers

The ads aim to rebrand data centers as more than just giant warehouses storing our digital lives. They're meant to be seen as hubs of innovation, community building, and social connection.

  • A 30-second spot shows a group of seniors chatting at a senior center, with the tagline: 'Keeping memories safe.'
  • An ad featuring a group of friends playing video games online highlights: 'Storing stories for good.'

The Goal: Winning Hearts and Minds

So, why is Meta pouring millions into this campaign? The goal is to change the public's perception of data centers from mere industrial facilities to symbols of progress, community, and connection.

But will it work? Only time – and the ad agency's creative genius – can tell. One thing's for sure: with $6.4 million on the line, Meta is betting big on the power of storytelling to shape public opinion.

title: Meet Moltbot, the AI Agent Revolutionizing Productivity
description: Say goodbye to tedious tasks! Moltbot, an open-source AI agent, is taking the world by storm by doing things for you. From reminders to health tracking, this game-changer is making waves in the tech community.
content:
Moltbot: The AI Agent That Actually Does Things

In a sea of chatbots and AI-powered assistants, Moltbot stands out as a refreshing change. This open-source agent doesn't just talk the talk; it walks the walk by performing actual tasks for you. And people are obsessed!

From managing reminders to logging health and fitness data, Moltbot is capable of handling a variety of tasks that were previously mundane or time-consuming. But what's truly impressive is its ability to learn and adapt to your needs.

The Power of Local Processing

Unlike cloud-based AI assistants, Moltbot runs locally on a variety of devices, giving users complete control over their data. This not only boosts security but also ensures faster processing times, making it perfect for those who value speed and efficiency.

  • Reminders: Set and forget with Moltbot's robust reminder system.
  • Health Tracking: Log your workouts, sleep patterns, and nutrition goals in one convenient place.
  • Client Communication: Seamlessly manage client inquiries and responses using Moltbot's natural language processing capabilities.

The potential applications are endless, and it's no wonder Moltbot has become the talk of the town. As more people discover its capabilities, we can expect to see a surge in creative uses for this groundbreaking AI agent. Whether you're a busy professional or a fitness enthusiast, Moltbot is poised to revolutionize your daily routine.

title: Crypto Bill in Congress Hits Roadblock as Partisan Fears Intensify
description: The Clarity Act, a much-anticipated cryptocurrency regulation bill, is facing unprecedented opposition as lawmakers grapple with the complexities of digital currencies. As tensions rise, the future of crypto remains uncertain.
content:
The Clarity Act, a landmark legislation aimed at regulating cryptocurrencies in the United States, is unraveling in Congress. Despite initially gaining momentum, the bill has hit a snag, thanks to a growing chorus of concerns from lawmakers and industry insiders alike.

A Perfect Storm

As the crypto market continues to evolve, so do the fears surrounding its regulation. The recent implosion of FTX, one of the largest cryptocurrency exchanges, has only exacerbated these concerns. With investors' confidence shaken, the pressure is mounting on lawmakers to address the perceived risks associated with digital currencies.

  • Partisan divisions are deepening, with Republicans and Democrats at odds over how to regulate the industry.
  • Lack of clarity around issues like taxation, consumer protection, and antitrust concerns has led to widespread unease.

title: Trump's De-Escalation Promise in Minnesota: A Glimmer of Hope Amidst Ongoing Immigration Crisis
description: In the wake of Alex Pretti's tragic shooting, Minnesota officials and locals are breathing a sigh of relief as Trump hints at 'de-escalating' his immigration operation. But will this change mark a turning point in the crisis?
content:
Washington D.C. - As the nation continues to grapple with the aftermath of Alex Pretti's senseless killing over the weekend, Minnesota officials and locals are calling for President Trump to put an end to his immigration operation in their state. And now, it seems like they might be getting their wish.

A Shift in Tone

In a surprise move, Trump hinted at 'de-escalating' his efforts in Minnesota during a recent press conference. While the President's words were vague and didn't explicitly commit to halting the operation, it marks a shift in tone that has brought some much-needed hope to those affected.

A Long Time Coming

The situation in Minnesota has been dire for months now, with local communities bearing the brunt of Trump's immigration policies. The killing of Alex Pretti serves as a poignant reminder of the human cost of these actions and the urgent need for change.

While some are skeptical about Trump's motives, many see this as a glimmer of hope that could lead to real progress. 'This is a major step in the right direction,' said Maria Hernandez, an activist with the Minnesota Immigration Advocates. 'We've been fighting for our rights and the rights of our families for far too long. It's time for some real change.'

A Long Road Ahead

However, even if Trump does follow through on his promise, it won't be a magic solution to the complex issues plaguing Minnesota's communities. There are still many challenges to overcome and much work to be done before we can truly say that progress has been made.

title: Minnesota Congresswoman Ilhan Omar Faced Down Fear with Courage, Continuing to Speak Out After Vile Attack
description: In a chilling incident at a town hall event, Minnesota congresswoman Ilhan Omar was attacked with an unknown liquid. Miraculously, she escaped uninjured and continued to speak out on issues that matter most.
content:
Minnesota Congresswoman Ilhan Omar has faced many challenges in her political career, but none as unsettling as the one she encountered during a recent town hall event. As she was speaking to constituents, an unknown liquid was thrown at her, sending shockwaves throughout the gathering.

A Show of Courage

Incredibly, Omar remained steadfast and continued to speak out on issues that matter most, refusing to let the cowardly attack silence her voice. 'I'm not going to let this incident discourage me from doing my job or speaking truthfully to power,' she stated resolutely.

  • Omar's bravery in the face of adversity has earned her widespread praise and admiration.

A Commitment to Justice

Omar has long been a champion for justice, advocating tirelessly for the rights of marginalized communities. Her unwavering dedication to this cause is evident in her unshakeable resolve to continue speaking out, despite attempts to silence her.

title: Storm Chandra Unleashes Fury on UK: Heavy Rain, Flooding, and Travel Chaos
description: As Storm Chandra brings strong winds and flooding to parts of the UK, residents are advised to take necessary precautions. Roads are treacherous, and travel disruptions are expected.
content:
Storm Chandra, a powerful weather system, is causing chaos across the UK as it brings heavy rain and strong winds to several regions.

Flooding and Travel Disruptions

The storm's impact has been particularly severe in coastal areas, where flooding has been reported. Residents are advised to avoid travel unless absolutely necessary, as roads are slippery and impassable in some cases.

  • In Wales, several towns have experienced significant flooding, prompting evacuations and road closures.
  • In the north of England, the M62 motorway is partially closed due to a landslide triggered by strong winds.

Weather Warnings Issued

The Met Office has issued severe weather warnings for several areas, including eastern and northern parts of England, Wales, and Scotland. Residents are advised to check local forecasts and stay tuned to updates from authorities.

In the face of such turbulent weather, emergency services are on high alert, ready to respond to any situations that may arise.

title: Benefit Blunders: Online Tools Leave Some in Financial Limbo
description: Campaigners warn that complex benefit calculators are causing confusion, leaving vulnerable individuals in dire financial straits. Here's why you should be concerned.
content:
When it comes to navigating the complexities of government benefits, most people rely on online tools to help guide them through the process. However, these very same tools can sometimes do more harm than good, particularly for those who are already struggling financially.

The Consequences of Confusion

Campaigners are sounding the alarm about the potential pitfalls of using benefits calculators, which can lead to incorrect or incomplete information being provided. This can have devastating consequences for individuals and families who are relying on these benefits to make ends meet.

  • Incorrectly calculated benefits can leave people without a safety net, leaving them vulnerable to poverty and financial hardship.
  • The lack of transparency in the calculation process can lead to disputes between claimants and authorities, causing further stress and uncertainty.

Avoiding the Pitfalls

To avoid falling into this trap, it's essential to take a closer look at how these calculators work. Here are some key things to consider:

• Be aware of the limitations: Understand that benefits calculators are not always 100% accurate and can be influenced by various factors.

• Check for updates: Make sure you're using the most up-to-date calculator, as changes in government policies or benefits rates can affect calculations.

• Seek expert advice: If you're unsure about your eligibility or need help navigating the system, consider consulting a financial advisor or advocacy group.

In conclusion, while online tools can be helpful, they should not replace human judgment and expertise. By being aware of the potential pitfalls and taking steps to ensure accuracy, we can prevent financial blunders and provide support for those who truly need it.

title: Warning of long airport queues under new EU border control system
description: Airport organisation says queues could last up to six hours over the summer holidays.
content:
Warning of long airport queues under new EU border control system

48 minutes ago

Share

Save

Katy Austin

,

Transport correspondent

and

Simon Browning

,

Transport reporter 

Share

Save

Getty Images

There are warnings of queues at passport control at airports in Europe over upcoming holiday periods, as the rollout of a new biometric border system continues.

Passengers have already reported hours-long waits at some destinations, at busy times, due to the new systems.

A group representing airports said there was a risk of five-to-six-hour queues over the summer.

However, the European Commission said it would be possible to suspend the new system at peak times until September.

Allow 

TikTok

 content?

This article contains content provided by 

TikTok

. We ask for your permission before anything is loaded, as they may be using cookies and other technologies. You may want to read 

TikTok’s cookie policy

 and 

privacy policy

 before accepting. To view this content choose 

‘accept and continue’

.

Accept and continue

Videos posted on social media in the past week describe three-hour queues at Geneva airport's passport control.

Geneva always gets busy during winter as skiers, Brits among them, head for the slopes. 

But the airport is blaming the new Entry-Exit System (EES) at border control for "congestion... particularly on Saturdays during the busy ski season".

A spokesperson said implementing EES had been a "major challenge for Swiss customs and Geneva Airport".

The spokesman said measures to try and make the process smoother included putting on more staff.

Getty Images

Tenerife remains a popular winter sun destination for Brits

Long waits have been reported at Tenerife, in the Canary Islands, too.

Andrew Knight runs Salasti car hire at Tenerife airport. Most of his customers are from the UK. Many of those arriving for winter sunshine have got stuck in long lines of passengers trying to get through the border kiosks.  

Those who have arrived at quieter times have progressed through passport control quickly, but

 

when when multiple aircraft have landed in short succession, queues have built up.

Some passengers have been getting through passport control "in about 20 minutes, other people are experiencing one and a half, two-hour delays waiting to use the systems. A few times the systems have gone down, so it's really hit and miss."

Getty Images

EES kiosks will collect biometric information from non-EU travellers entering the Schengen area

The digital Entry Exit System will eventually replace ink stamps on passports.

It requires non-EU citizens to register fingerprints and a photo alongside having their passport scanned the first time they cross a border of the Schengen free-movement zone. This registration lasts three years.

Air travellers do it upon arrival at European airports, usually with an automated machine or kiosk. The details are verified on future entries. 

The system is part-way through a gradual introduction period which began in October.

At the moment, half of border points are meant to be operating EES, with at least a third of non-EU passengers using it.

Julia Lo Bue-Said, who runs travel agent network Advantage Partnership, said "without question, the new system has created even more bottlenecks and pinch points [in places] that were already challenged." 

Border process takes longer

Olivier Jankovec is director general of Airports Council International Europe, which represents more than 600 airports.  

He told the BBC the passenger processing time at border control had increased by "four to five times" under EES, with people typically waiting up to two hours.  

Jankovec said problems included not enough border staff, and some machines not working. 

He fears the situation will worsen when large numbers of holidaymakers register over Easter and summer.

Markus Lammert, European Commission Spokesperson for Internal Affairs, says 23m entries and exits have already been registered under EES, and there have been 12,000 refusals of entry.

He insisted the system has operated "largely without issues", but said member states would continue to work on improvements.

From 10 April, EES is meant to be in use at every border point, for every eligible passenger.

However, countries can partially suspend EES operations where necessary over the summer, until September.

Jankovec said this would be necessary to cope if "the situation becomes unsustainable at border control".

Without it, and if issues around the equipment and border guard numbers didn't improve, he warned of five-to-six-hour waiting times.

The group said close coordination was needed with border control authorities to make sure they could suspend the system "in a timely manner".

On Thursday, travel association ABTA said border authorities were under-using their ability to reduce checks when necessary, and said this had led to passengers being "caught up in lengthy delays".

ABTA said that as well applying the contingency measures, destinations and border authorities need to do more to plan for peak travel periods. 

Julia Lo Bue-Said advised people to come prepared for long waits over the February half term and beyond.

"Plan for the worst", she advises, especially at peak times. "Make sure you've got some refreshments, make sure you've got something to keep [small children] occupied".

Airport security

Travel

Air travel

Passports

title: Workers urge Target and US firms to speak up over ICE raids
description: Workers are writing letters, staging strikes and in some cases resigning over how bosses are handling the immigration crackdown.
content:
Workers urge Target and US firms to speak up over ICE raids

4 hours ago

Share

Save

Danielle Kaye

Business reporter

Share

Save

Reuters

Demonstrators participate in a protest at a Target store to pressure the company to do more to protect employees and community members from ongoing immigration enforcement, in West St. Paul, Minnesota, U.S., January 19, 2026.

Target and other major Minnesota businesses are facing rising discontent from staff, as workers fear the Trump administration's immigration crackdown puts them at risk on the job.

Employees are pushing firms to provide clearer guidance about how to respond if Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) officers arrive at their worksites - and asking them to do more to limit agents' access to stores and parking lots.

The pressures have been particularly acute at Target, a national name and one of the state's flagship employers, after the detention of two workers inside one of its suburban Minneapolis stores last month.

In the aftermath, more than 300 staff signed an internal letter, seen by the BBC, urging executives to speak up, and take steps to keep ICE officers off Target properties.

Target cashier Sandra Macmillan, 71, said she resigned last month after seeing the videos, which showed masked agents pinning the two employees to the ground in the store's entryway before pushing them into a vehicle, while one shouted: "I'm literally a US citizen".

"I looked online and saw no response from Target," said Macmillan, who had worked for the company in Texas since 2021, calling it "the last straw". "There was no acknowledgement whatsoever."

Sandra Macmillan

Sandra Macmillan, 71, had worked as a cashier at a Target store in Texas since 2021. 

Experts said to what extent firms can restrict access to their properties was a murky legal area.

Target said it had shared resources related to personal safety and ICE protocols with in-store and corporate teams.

Michael Fiddelke, Target's new chief executive who officially took the helm of the retailer this week, told staff in a video message in late January that "the violence and loss of life in our community is incredibly painful".

"We are doing everything we can to manage what's in our control, always keeping the safety of our team and guests our top priority," he said in the video, a transcript of which was reviewed by the BBC.

Still, the company has not publicly responded to the in-store ICE arrests in January, and did not comment on that incident to the BBC.

The tensions at businesses are part of the fallout as US President Donald Trump moves to deliver on his promises of stricter immigration enforcement, a focal point of his winning 2024 election campaign. 

He has sent thousands of ICE agents to Minneapolis in recent weeks in an initiative dubbed "Operation Metro Surge", which officials say is aimed at restoring public safety by arresting and deporting undocumented immigrants with criminal records.

The administration's tactics have prompted thousands nationwide to take to the streets in protest. Federal agents shot and killed two US citizens in Minneapolis last month, and migrants with clean records and US citizens have been caught up in the crackdown.

Workplaces have emerged as a key battleground, as officers use them to make detentions.

Anti-ICE activists have responded with protests aimed at businesses, including Target, Home Depot, DR Horton and the Hilton hotel chain. But instances of firms denying service to ICE agents have also drawn swift backlash from the Trump administration.

After a Hilton franchisee near Minneapolis declined to rent rooms to ICE agents, the Department of Homeland Security blasted the firm on social media for impeding law enforcement.

Hilton later cut ties with that franchise. It then temporarily closed other locations in the city, citing security risks.

On Wednesday, the White House said it would start withdrawing some of its ICE agents from Minneapolis, but said that officers have a responsibility to enforce the law.

In the meantime, concerns about safety have pitted employees against bosses.

Late last month, executives at more than 60 Minnesota-based firms, including Target, signed a letter urging "an immediate deescalation of tensions".

But the statement did not mention ICE by name - and did little to quell frustration among employees looking for a stronger pushback.

A Home Depot spokesperson told the BBC that the home improvement retailer "cannot legally interfere with federal enforcement agencies, including preventing them from coming into our stores and parking lots".

Home Depot and Target said they did not coordinate with ICE. DR Horton and Hilton did not respond to requests for comment. 

'A line too far'

ICE Out Now Coalition

Unidos Minnesota, a nonprofit group that advocates for immigrant rights, helped organise a rally outside Target's Minneapolis headquarters on February 2.

The muted response from Target, which is headquartered in Minneapolis and has long been a corporate leader in the state, has drawn particular scrutiny.

It has added to the challenges at the firm, which has struggled to navigate political controversies related to its diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) practices and LGBTQ merchandise.

"Target is Minnesota's leading corporate citizen," said Ulla Nilsen, an organiser with the immigrant rights non-profit Unidos Minnesota, which helped organise a rally outside Target's Minneapolis headquarters on Monday.

"As a corporate citizen, are you going to stay silent and allow our democracy to be completely destroyed?"

Five people who worked at Target last month, most of whom spoke to the BBC on condition of anonymity for fear of retaliation, described growing frustration among staff sparked by the ICE response.

One Minnesota-based corporate employee in the marketing division told the BBC he handed in his two-week notice in mid-January, calling Target's handling of the issue "a line too far".

Another staffer, who works at a store in Milwaukee, Wisconsin located in a predominantly Hispanic neighbourhood, said he had not received guidance on what to do if ICE were to be deployed to the area, calling the lack of clarity "discouraging".

But he said he was sceptical of demands that the firm challenge the ICE crackdown more directly.

"With the current administration right now, it seems like ICE kind of has a free-for-all to do whatever they want. And I don't exactly see how Target is going to go against that," he said.

How much can employers do?

At one restaurant, run by a prominent Minneapolis restaurant group, frustration about how executives were handling the issue prompted staff to go on strike for three days in late January, according to Hazel, an employee who asked to be referred to by only her first name.

Last week, the two sides reached an agreement on how to handle ICE, which included posting signs explicitly denying agents access to private areas of the restaurants without a judicial warrant.

But legal experts said companies are in a tough spot when it comes to limiting access.

Access to non-public areas like employee break rooms requires a signed judicial warrant.

But the rules governing "quasi-public" spaces are less clear, which means that in many cases, it is up to employers to make their own assessments, said Jessie Hahn, an attorney at the National Immigration Law Center.

"It's very difficult for employers, because they want to make sure they're addressing their employees' concerns, but also operating within the parameters of the law," Shanon Stevenson, a partner at law firm Fisher Phillips, said.

Activists and worker groups say firms should do more.

Rena Wong, president of the United Food and Commercial Workers Local 663 in Minnesota, said some union members have expressed alarm after workers were seized in parking lots where they work. The union represents grocery store employees at several large chains.

Even workers that are US citizens say they are concerned about being detained because of their race, Wong said. In September, the Supreme Court ruled that it is legal for immigration agents to use race as a factor when deciding who to question about immigration status.

Wong said some chains had adopted policies to limit cooperation with ICE on private property in response. But she added: "The call from employers needs to be stronger, because they are being impacted too, economically."

The Centro de Trabajadores Unidos en Lucha, a Twin Cities worker centre, is campaigning for DR Horton, America's largest home builder, and other large housing developers to speak up.

"These are some of the biggest economic players in the state and nationwide," said executive director Merle Payne, who said ICE agents had visited a DR Horton site in Shakopee, Minnesota at least three times this year.

"They have the power and influence to stand up and demand an end to the raids."

International Business

Retailing

Minnesota

Minneapolis

title: US probes Nike over white workers' discrimination claims
description: Court documents allege the sportswear company treated white employees less favourably.
content:
US probes Nike over white workers' discrimination claims

13 hours ago

Share

Save

Natalie Sherman

BBC News

Share

Save

Reuters

Nike is under investigation by the US government over claims the footwear giant discriminated against white workers. 

The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC), which enforces workplace discrimination laws, announced on Wednesday it has demanded company records going back to 2018, including the use of race and ethnicity data, and whether such information influenced executive pay.

Court documents show it is examining claims the firm engaged "in a pattern or practice of disparate treatment against white employees, applicants, and training program participants".

Nike said it was "committed to fair and lawful employment practices", calling the inquiry "a surprising and unusual escalation".

In a statement, the company said it followed all laws against discrimination.

"We believe our programs and practices are consistent with those obligations and take these matters seriously. We will continue our attempt to cooperate with the EEOC and will respond to the petition."

The decision to go to battle with Nike, a high-profile consumer brand, is one of the first major actions the EEOC has taken under US President Donald Trump, who has attacked diversity initiatives, saying they amount to "reverse discrimination".

The EEOC said its investigation was sparked by a 2024 complaint from America First Legal, a partisan organisation founded by Trump adviser Stephen Miller that identifies "dismantling diversity, equity and inclusion" or DEI as a top priority.

In its subpoena request, the EEOC said Nike had failed to fully respond to requests seeking information  about the firm's hiring, training and promotion practices, as well as hiring goals for racial and ethnic minorities.

Those requests started 13 months ago and included a prior subpoena, according to the court filing.

"Nike's failure to comply ... has delayed and hampered the EEOC's investigation of alleged unlawful employment practices," court documents stated.

New US rules say countries with diversity policies are infringing human rights

Nike pledges to cut reliance on Chinese factories

Trump puts all US government diversity staff on paid leave 'immediately'

Nike said it had already submitted thousands of pages of information to the EEOC in response to its inquiries.

It has argued the investigation should be dropped because the company is being questioned about diversity policies that the federal agency previously supported.

The EEOC was created as part of the 1964 Civil Rights Act.

But the White House has sought to redirect the commission away from its historic focus on bias affecting minority groups and women.

Andrea Lucas, the chair of the EEOC, has previously said many standard workplace programmes may potentially violate US laws and invited white men to come forward with complaints.

The agency is seeking extensive information as part of the Nike subpoena, including personal information of "all employees considered or evaluated for potential layoff" during the company's 2024 job cuts, according to the court filing.

The EEOC is engaged in a similar battle with Northwestern Mutual Life Insurance, which said, in its response, the commission had failed to identify clearly what the firm was doing wrong.

Michael Foreman, director of the Civil Rights Appellate Clinic at Penn State Dickinson Law, called the Nike inquiry "more of EEOC's consistent pattern of basically being the bully pulpit for the Trump administration", in an attempt to discourage strong diversity efforts.

"What about discrimination based upon minority status? Based upon national origin?

"These other types of discrimination that are so prevalent are going unaddressed by this agency," he added.

Additional reporting by Danielle Kaye

Companies

United States

Nike, Inc.

title: Bank of England expected to hold interest rates
description: Interest rates were cut to 3.75% in December and analysts expect at least one further reduction this year.
content:
Bank of England expected to hold interest rates

11 hours ago

Share

Save

Kevin Peachey

Cost of living correspondent

Share

Save

EPA

Interest rates are expected to remain on hold as the Bank of England's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meets for the first time this year.

The MPC cut the Bank rate from 4% to 3.75% in December, and suggested rates were 

"likely to continue on a gradual downward path"

.

The Bank rate is the primary tool for the committee to try to keep inflation - which charts the annual rate of rising prices - as close to 2% as possible.

It heavily influences the interest charged by lenders for loans and mortgages, and what banks and building societies give in returns to savers.

The majority of analysts are predicting the MPC keeps the Bank rate on hold at 3.75% when it announces its latest decision at 12:00 GMT on Thursday.

Inflation remains above target at 3.4%, according to the latest data for the year to December.

The nine-member committee only narrowly voted for a cut in December and gave a fairly cautious view of the situation.

Analysts say there has been little data so far this year to change the balance between persistent inflation and weak economic growth.

There is also an expectation that the Bank will be vague about when or by how much it will cut the Bank rate during the year as it awaits a clearer picture on inflation.

Some analysts are suggesting one rate cut during 2026, while others believe the MPC could decide on two cuts.

How rates affect your finances

Around a third of households have a mortgage. Of those, about one million have tracker or variable mortgages that tend to change when the Bank rate changes.

The vast majority of mortgage customers have fixed-rate deals. While their monthly payments are not immediately affected by a rate change, future deals can be.

Fixed mortgage rates, for those renewing or signing up to a new deal, fell at the start of the year as lenders competed for customers.

However, broader pressures faced by lenders have shown signs of going up, with commentators saying that could stall any further cuts.

The Bank rate cut in December and conditions thereafter have led to cuts in the interest paid by savings account providers to their customers.

Rachel Springall, from financial information service Moneyfacts, said: "The slaughter of savings rates will sadden hard-pressed savers. Since the start of this year, more than two-thirds (70%) of savings providers have cut their rates. 

"As inflation remains well above target, real returns on cash savings are weak and this can lead to a dangerous attitude of apathy."

The MPC has eight meetings a year and, after the latest meeting, it will also publish its quarterly Monetary Policy Report, which sets out its economic analysis and projections on which it bases its decision.

title: US launches plan to tackle China's critical minerals dominance
description: The event was attended by representatives of more than 50 countries, the White House said.
content:
US launches plan to tackle China's critical minerals dominance

8 hours ago

Share

Save

Kali Hays

,

Technology reporter

and

Peter Hoskins

,

Business reporter

Share

Save

Getty Images

JD Vance and Marco Rubio at the first Critical Minerals Ministerial event on Wednesday

The US has launched an effort to form a trade zone for critical minerals that are key to making everything from smartphones to weapons as it tries to break China's dominance of the industry.

On Wednesday, the State Department hosted the first Critical Minerals Ministerial event - which was attended by countries and organisations including the UK, European Union, Japan, India, South Korea, Australia and the Democratic Republic of Congo.

Delegates discussed the availability of and access to minerals crucial to the manufacture of things like computer chips and electric vehicle batteries.

The mining and processing of such critical minerals, which include rare earths, is dominated by China.

In remarks released by the US government, Vice President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio did not mention China by name.

Instead, Vance referred to the "foreign supply" of such minerals flooding global markets, making it difficult for other countries with mineral deposits to secure the financing needed to produce them.

The US planned to use tariffs to stop critical mineral prices falling too low, which can deter investment, he said.

David Copley, a special assistant to President Donald Trump, said the US intends to "deploy hundreds of billions of capital into the mining sector to get projects going".

Investments have already been made in several companies, including rare earths magnets maker MP Materials and Lithium Americas, which produces material key to rechargeable batteries, he said.

US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer also said that the US, Japan and the European Commission are developing "coordinated trade policies and mechanisms" in order to collectively avoid potential issues with access to important minerals.

Ahead of the meeting, a Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson said "countries need to follow the principles of market economy and international economic and trade rules, step up communication and dialogue".

The event was part of a broader effort by the US government to counter China's ability to use its dominance of the industry as leverage in trade negotiations.

On Monday, Trump announced the creation of a critical mineral reserve, called "Project Vault", worth almost $12bn (£8.8bn).

Industry figures welcomed the announcement.

"It's critical to see the United States take decisive steps to shore up our supply of all kinds of minerals and rare earths," said Wade Senti, president of Advanced Magnet Lab.

Wednesday's event took place on the same day that 

Trump had a phone call with his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping

, which the US president described as "very positive."

China has a chokehold on rare earths and has tightened its grip over exports in recent months.

Beijing requires companies in China to get government approval before shipping the minerals abroad.

When 

the curbs were tightened in October

 it dealt a major blow to the US, whose industries are heavily dependent on these imports.

The Chinese government soon eased those stricter measures but analysts say it is using its dominance as a key bargaining chip in trade talks with Washington.

China controls the rare earths the world buys - can Trump's new deals change that?
